Class Poise

java.lang.Object
Poise
public class Poise
extends java.lang.Object
This program manages the project data of a structural engineering company's projects, which are contain in a database. The program is able to add new projects, edit existing projects, view projects and finalise projects.
Author:
Lindsey
See Also:
- Class for project objects, - Class for project contact objects

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Imports a list of project objects for editing and recording/creating new project objects.

      Uses Scanner class to get inputs from user.

      Connects to poisePMS database using mySQL.

      The main menu allow a user to add a new project, edit a project, view a selected project view incomplete projects and view overdue projects. The edit menu allows a user to change the project deadline, add a payment to the total amount paid, edit the contractor details, or finalise a project in the poisePMS database

      Parameters:
      args - The command line arguments

    • connectToDatabase

      public static java.sql.Connection connectToDatabase()
      Makes connection to the poisePMS database.

      Returns:
      the connection to poisePMS

    • getProjects

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Project> getProjects​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates an array list of project objects, using the values from the poisePMS database.

      The values extracted from the poisePMS database are contained in 5 tables - projects, sites, customers, contractors and architects. These tables are combined using INNER JOIN when the query is run, which enables all relevant project data to be accessed in one query.

      Once all project values have been accessed, the values are saved as variables. The variables are used to create the project contact objects, and the related project objects. These objects are then added to the array list.

      Parameters:
      statement - The line to the database for running queries
      Returns:
      The array list containing all existing project objects listed in the database.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - - If a database error occurs.

    • newContact

      public static ProjectContact newContact​(java.util.Scanner userInput, java.lang.String contact)
      Creates a new Project Contact object by using a Scanner to get the required attribute values from the user.
      Parameters:
      userInput - The Scanner which will be used for the user input values.
      contact - The contact value which can be either "Customer", "Contractor" or "Architect".
      Returns:
      The new Project Contact object

    • addProject

      public static void addProject​(java.util.Scanner userInput, java.util.ArrayList<Project> projects, java.sql.Statement statement, java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Prompts user to input project attribute values for a new project object, constructs the new project object and adds it to the array list of projects and updates the poisePMS database.

      Project number entries are limited to unique values. Any entry is compared to the existing project numbers before they are accepted. Invalid entries restart the loop for the user to enter the value.

      ERF numbers, customer names, contractor names and architect names are limited to unique values for new entries to the database. If a duplicate is entered, the details of the duplicated entry will not be saved to the database.

      Caught exceptions restart the loops for user entries which need to be parsed.

      Parameters:
      userInput - The Scanner used to read user inputs.
      projects - The array list of projects.
      statement - The line to the database to run queries.
      connection - The connection to the database used to control changes committed.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - If the method is called on a closed connection.

    • updateDeadline

      public static Project updateDeadline​(Project project, java.util.Scanner userInput, java.sql.Statement statement)
      Updates the deadline value for the selected project object.

      The method uses a scanner to get a new deadline from the user, and updates the database. The method then uses the formatDateString method to parse it to a new date value. The new date value is set as the deadline for the selected project object.

      Parameters:
      project - The project object selected to edit.
      userInput - The Scanner used to input the new deadline.
      statement - The line to the database to run queries.
      Returns:
      The project object containing the updated deadline.
      See Also:
      formatDateString(java.lang.String)

    • updateContractor

      public static Project updateContractor​(Project project, java.util.Scanner userInput, java.sql.Statement statement, java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Updates the Contractor project contact object for the selected project object.

      Parameters:
      project - The project object selected to edit.
      userInput - The Scanner used to input the new Contractor contact details.
      statement - The line to the database to run queries.
      connection - The connection to the database.
      Returns:
      The project object containing the updated Contractor project contact object
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - ifdatabase error occurs.

    • updatePaid

      public static Project updatePaid​(Project project, java.util.Scanner userInput, java.sql.Statement statement)
      Updates the amount paid for the project object.

      The scanner reads the input and parses it to a double value. The value is added to the project's total amount paid. The result of the equation is set as the selected project's new total paid value.

      Parameters:
      project - The project object selected to edit.
      userInput - The Scanner used to input the new payment amount.
      statement - The line to the database to run queries.
      Returns:
      The project object containing the updated amount of fees paid
      Throws:
      java.lang.NumberFormatException - The exception is handled by a try catch block.

    • finaliseProject

      public static Project finaliseProject​(Project project, java.sql.Statement statement)
      Finalises project object.

      The invoice is printed using the printInvoice method.

      The completion date is set as the current date at the time the project is finalised, and formatted to be displayed as "yyyy-MM-dd".

      The project string is written to the required text file using the saveToFile method.

      Parameters:
      project - The project selected to be finalised
      statement - The line to the database to run queries.
      Returns:
      The finalised project object
      See Also:
      printInvoice(Project)

    • printSelectedProject

      public static void printSelectedProject​(java.util.ArrayList<Project> projects, java.util.Scanner userInput)
      Allows the user to select and print a project from the projects array list to the console.

      There is a loop to receive the project selection from the user. Invalid selections will trigger an error message, and restart the loop.

      Parameters:
      projects - The array list of project objects.
      userInput - The Scanner used for the user to select a project

    • printOverdueProjects

      public static void printOverdueProjects​(java.util.ArrayList<Project> projects)
      Prints the project objects that are overdue.

      The method first checks if the project is complete, by checking the value for the completion date. If this value is null, the project is not finalised.

      The method then checks the deadline of the incomplete projects. If the current date is after the deadline and the completion date is empty, the project is printed.

      Parameters:
      projects - The list of project objects

    • printIncompleteProjects

      public static void printIncompleteProjects​(java.util.ArrayList<Project> projects)
      Prints the project objects that are incomplete.

      To check whether the project is incomplete, the loop searches for an empty string (null value) as a completion date value.

      Parameters:
      projects - The list of project objects
